request.description: The `/collections` endpoint returns a list of all [collections](https://www.getpostman.com/docs/collections) that are accessible by you. The list includes your own collections and the collections that you have subscribed to. The response contains an array of collection information containing the `name`, `id`, `owner` and `uid` of each collection. > Requires API Key as `X-Api-Key` request header or `apikey` URL query parameter.

exec: pm.test("response json data should not have errors", function () {
pm.test("response json should contain one collection", function () {
// additional tests to ensure that the relevant environment variables are present
pm.test('"postman_api_key" variable should be present', function () {
// you can unskip this test in case you want to have a stricter check on the selected
pm.test.skip('"collection_uid" variable should be present', function () {

request.description: Access the contents of a collection that is accessible to you using its unique id (`uid`). > Requires API Key as `X-Api-Key` request header or `apikey` URL query parameter.

request.description: This endpoint allows you to create collections using the Postman Collection v2 format. For more information about the v2 schema, check the format [here](https://schema.getpostman.com/json/collection/v2.0.0/docs/index.html). On successful creation of the collection, the response returns the collection `name`, `id` and the `uid`. You can also specify the context of a workspace to create a collection in directly by passing the `workspace` as a query param. > Requires API Key as `X-Api-Key` request header or `apikey` URL query parameter.

query.description: The workspace ID in which the collection is to be created

exec: pm.test("response json data should not have errors", function () {
pm.test("response json should contain one collection", function () {
// additional tests to ensure that the relevant environment variables are present
pm.test('"postman_api_key" variable should be present', function () {
// we double check the request to ensure that relevant parameters are present
pm.test("request body must have valid json", function () {
// the request body collection should have the same collection Id as sent in URL
// you can unskip this test in case you want to have a stricter check on the selected
pm.test.skip('"collection_uid" variable should be present', function () {

request.description: This endpoint allows you to update an existing collection using the Postman Collection v2 format. For more information about the v2 schema, check the format [here](https://schema.getpostman.com/json/collection/v2.0.0/docs/index.html). On successful updation of the collection, the response returns the collection `name`, `id` and `uid`. > Requires API Key as `X-Api-Key` request header or `apikey` URL query parameter. Note: Please be careful when trying to update the collection, as the existing collection will be replaced by the request body.

response.name: Not Enough Permissions
response.body: {"error":{"name":"forbiddenError","message":"You do not have enough permissions to perform this action."}}

response.name: Collection ID Mismatch
response.body: {"error":{"name":"collectionMismatchError","message":"The collection ID in the path does not match the collection ID in the request body."}}

request.description: This endpoint allows you to delete an existing collection. On successful deletion of the collection, the response returns the `id` and `uid`. > Requires API Key as `X-Api-Key` request header or `apikey` URL query parameter.
